channel.title: Need BCEL help
channel.description:
This is sort of a spinoff of my old topic.
If you read the other thread then you know I'm trying to develop a bot for RSC.
What I'm trying to perform RSC actions like drop item, cast spell, thieve NPC, and so on.
All of these are inside the client, and I need a way to invoke these methods, because I can't with reflection.
Here is the drop method where k1 is the slot:
[code] hh.a(246, (byte)68); ((o) (hh)).c.a(k1, (byte)-114); hh.c(0); [/code]
What I'm confused about is using BCEL to create an instance of say hh.a.
I have my interface that I can include into the client with the methods I need, but how do I push methods like hh.a, hh.c.a, and hh.c?

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

Ollie:

read about profiling: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Profiling_(computer_programming)

Thanks for the link.

Edit: Still can’t track down the problem…

Edit: Fixed. No more crashes or high memory usage.

I can’t figure out why I can’t get my banking to work.

It’s hardly any different than any other actions used in the client with the exception of one method - hh.b.

Here’s RSC:

        hh.a(22, (byte)59);
        ((o) (hh)).c.a(k2, (byte)63);
        ((o) (hh)).c.b(-91, 50);
        ((o) (hh)).c.b(127, 0x12345678);
        hh.c(0);

Here’s my code:

		sendID(22, (byte) 59);
		sendInt(10, (byte) 63);
		sendDouble(-91, (byte) 50);
		sendDouble(127, 0x12345678);
		CloseConnection();

As far as I’m concerned, I am using the right methods, but they simply aren’t doing anything when executed.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

I can sit there and watch my bot at random, increase 100k memory by 900kb every second. Seems to happen at random until it crashes. I do not know why or where to look.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

Ah well.

Any suggestions for the exception I posted up there? ^

I can’t figure out why my bot keeps logging my guy out and eventually crashes running for 1-2 hours.

I’m not calling methods extremely quickly or anything, my guy just gets logged out at random.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

Yeah true.

Can someone tell me why this is giving me a nullpointer?

Here’s my method as it appears in the client:

Here’s the same methods as it appears elsewhere in the client:

lb lb2 = e(k1, 0); int i3 = (-64 + lb2.E) / al;

Just trying to get the E field, but my method keeps getting an InvocationTargetException caused by an NPE.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

Meh… I was doing INVOKEVIRTUAL instead of INVOKESTATIC…

I’m taking a different route than that now since what I was trying was just stupid.

Success!

First RSC action executed. I added methods sendint/closeconnection/send id into the client using the appropriate fields in the client.

Looks something like this:

Doesn’t handle parameters yet, that’s for later when I can stand to look at more BCEL for a while.

I did have to switch back to loading from the loader to the client directly which much slower. The loader doesn’t work like I thought it did. As a matter of fact, I’m not sure where it’s pulling the classes from, or what makes loading through rsclassic.jar so slow.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:


You’re inserting instructions in the wrong order; instead, you’d like to push 0 and then false, and then ultimately invoke the method. Don’t forget that there is a ‘this’ operand for virtual invokes that must be on the stack before any arguments.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

I have created the methods that I need, but I keep getting this error:

Google’d it and someone wrote that it’s because I’m passing arguments before Invoking the method.

The method is o.c(int, boolean) and here’s what I’m inserting into CloseConnection:


	                list.insert(new INVOKEVIRTUAL(cgen.addMethodref("o", "c", "(IZ)V")));
	                list.insert(new PUSH(cgen, false));
	                list.insert(new PUSH(cgen, 0));

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

hh isn’t a class, it’s a reference to the k class which is a subclass of o where method a is located.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @DonkeyKongTHDJ DonkeyKongTHDJ
item.description:
@DonkeyKongTHDJ wrote:

I know that hh.a is not an object.

I need to use hh to invoke method a.

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

hh.a is a method, not a reference to an object. Learn the language semantics before you try to get too far ahead of yourself.

Read full topic
